span.span: Home » Public Health » Novel Coronavirus 2019 – COVID-19

h2.span: Sign up to stay informed on COVID-19 updates

div.p: Subscribe to our daily situation status report to stay informed on Coronavirus (COVID-19) updates as well as receive relevant public service announcements. Emails are sent Monday – Friday at 8pm.

div.h4: Weekly Virtual Town Halls on YouTube
div.p: Coos Health & Wellness will be conducting weekly virtual town halls via YouTube Live on our YouTube channel. The virtual town halls are scheduled for every Tuesday from 5:30 – 6:30 pm.
Simply head over to the Coos Health & Wellness YouTube channel page, wait for our live stream to start, and then click on the video to tune in. You can find our YouTube channel page here:

a.class: vcex-button theme-button align-center inline hvr hvr-glow

div.p: This will be an hour to discuss changes in COVID-19 guidance, Federal/State/Local directions for you as a consumer, and the chance to ask your questions to our local Public Health professionals. Please join us weekly, via YouTube LIVE, to be a part of the conversation.
If you would like to ask questions, you can email us in advance at covid19.questions@chw.coos.or.us or ask during the live feed in the comments section. We look forward to having you join us.

div.h4: Please feel free to reach out to us should you have any questions:
Por favor, no dude en commincarse con nosotros si tiene alguna pregunta:

strong.a: covid19.questions@chw.coos.or.us

a.strong: Contact Tracing Can Stop & Slow Infectious Disease Outbreaks
El Rastreo De Contacto Puede Parar Y Lentarse Brotes De Enfermedades Infecciosas

div.class: vc_general vc_tta vc_tta-accordion vc_tta-color-grey vc_tta-style-flat vc_tta-shape-rounded vc_tta-o-shape-group vc_tta-controls-align-left vc_tta-o-all-clickable

a.span: Click here to view volunteer opportunities

div.p: In coordination with the Emergency Operations Crew for Coos County, it is important to ensure that the most vulnerable people receive help and that all volunteers and recipients of support are safe. If you’re healthy and low risk and would like to help and volunteer, please email Angela Mayfield, Volunteer Coordinator, at: Angela.Mayfield@chw.coos.or.us or call 541-266-6703.

If you want to contribute to the work for the homeless task force for COVID-19 and ensure that people could self-isolate if they were positive with the virus, please go to: emergencyfundforthehomeless.com

a.strong: CDC Guidance: Use of Cloth Face Coverings to Help Slow the Spread of COVID-19
Oregon Guidance on Use of Homemade Masks or Face Coverings by the Public to Prevent Spread of COVID-19: April 4, 2020

div.p: Bay Area Hospital is accepting donations of sewn face masks (hospital-approved patterns can be found on their Facebook page) from the general community.
Donations can be delivered to the screening stations at either the main hospital entrance or at the Emergency Room entrance between the hours of 7:00 am and 5:00 pm.

Donations are also being collected at Coos Head Co-Op located at 353 S 2nd Street in Coos Bay. They are open Monday-Friday from 9:00 am to 7:00 pm, Saturdays from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm, and Sundays from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm.

p.strong: Click HERE for hospital-approved face mask patterns from Bay Area Hospital Facebook page.

a.title: During the COVID-19 situation if you are uninsured, under insured, or losing your insurance reach out to Renee Hacker (541-266-6743) and Kelsey Hill (Spanish speaking, 541-266-6735) at Coos Health & Wellness to assist you over the phone to apply for OHP and answer any questions. Please see the full PSA for more information - find the link in our bio. #CoosCounty

img.alt: During the COVID-19 situation if you are uninsured, under insured, or losing your insurance reach out to Renee Hacker (541-266-6743) and Kelsey Hill (Spanish speaking, 541-266-6735) at Coos Health & Wellness to assist you over the phone to apply for OHP and answer any questions. Please see the full PSA for more information - find the link in our bio. #CoosCounty

a.title: For questions regarding COVID-19 and the most up to date guidance, please email Covid19.questions@chw.coos.or.us or visit our COVID-19 page on our website.

img.alt: For questions regarding COVID-19 and the most up to date guidance, please email Covid19.questions@chw.coos.or.us or visit our COVID-19 page on our website.

a.title: Subscribe to our daily situation status report to stay informed on Coronavirus (COVID-19) updates as well as receive relevant public service announcements. a.title: Oregon Health Authority shared today. Kids often react to stressful events differently than adults. How the kid in your life reacts to #COVID19 will vary by age, their previous experiences and how they typically cope with stress. You can learn more about how to support kids here: http://ow.ly/i81h50zoQAp

img.alt: Oregon Health Authority shared today. Kids often react to stressful events differently than adults. a.title: Coos Health & Wellness appreciates the coordination of Shutter Creek Correctional Institution (SCCI) in addressing the recent confirmed COVID-19 cases with connection to their facility. As public health officials continue contact tracing we understand the community’s concern regarding the health and safety of Coos County and request the community to be mindful that the staff from SCCI are individuals that help make up the fabric of our community. Please see the full PSA to learn more - find the link in our bio. #CoosCounty

img.alt: Coos Health & Wellness appreciates the coordination of Shutter Creek Correctional Institution (SCCI) in addressing the recent confirmed COVID-19 cases with connection to their facility. As public health officials continue contact tracing we understand the community’s concern regarding the health and safety of Coos County and request the community to be mindful that the staff from SCCI are individuals that help make up the fabric of our community. Please see the full PSA to learn more - find the link in our bio. #CoosCounty

a.title: Coos Health & Wellness reports the 9th confirmed case of COVID-19 in Coos County. This is the first confirmed case of a staff member at Shutter Creek Correctional Institution, the origin of previous cases. Please see our full PSA to learn more - find the link in our bio.
